intro: Gutenbergia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf gutenbergia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a heart-shaped base, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Gutenbergia cordifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties.
